Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Acidicin P (natural AMPs, two-chain class 2b, two-component bacteriocin, UCLL2a; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals sequence alpha showed a low level of similarity (38.46%) toChrysophsin-1R: 25%. I=V=M=A=N: 10%. The amino acid sequence of chain beta: KKKRGFWYHVGDAVTSFGRGFASAFG (net charge +6, Pho: 38%; 26 amino acids).Activity: Agar well diffusion assay: the two chains were tested at various ratios and 1:1 was found to be most active (beta chain more active). Active against indicator strains S. agalactiae 10465, L. monocytogenes 1.10753 (MIC 2.36 uM), enterotoxigenic E. coli K88, and vancomycin-resistant E. faecalis V583.Structure: became helical in 50% TFE. Alpha chain is much more helical than beta chain.MOA:bacteria: permeated membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Xia T, Teng K, Liu Y, Guo Y, Huang F, Tahir M, Wang T, Zhong J. 2023
Literature Information.Title: A Novel Two-Component Bacteriocin, Acidicin P, and Its Key Residues for Inhibiting Listeria monocytogenes by Targeting the Cell Membrane.
